entry.title: buck, baffled and billboarded
entry.summary:
Author: madforyou

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,013Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 78

Summary: Thereâ€™s a billboard. Which is a normal thing to find on the side of the interstate. Advertisements for car dealerships and injury lawyers and anything you could ever dream of. This, thoughâ€¦ this is beyond his wildest dreams. This billboard has a picture of a man, about Eddieâ€™s age, blond curly hair and crystal blue eyes. The man on the billboard isâ€” He isâ€” The billboard text swims into focus slowly, as if Eddie is surfacing from deep water. THIS IS BUCK.HEâ€™S 33, SINGLE, AND A FIREFIGHTER.HEâ€™S A GREAT COOK IF YOU DONâ€™T MINDBREAKFAST FOOD FOR EVERY MEAL.Iâ€™M BEGGING SOMEONE TO DATE HIM SOHE STOPS THIRD-WHEELING MY MARRIAGE. And then, underneath, in smaller letters: ALL GENDERS WELCOME TO APPLY.I'M DESPERATE AND HE'S HOPELESS.PLEASE CONTACT MADDIE AT:[emailÂ protected] Or,The sisterly art of romantic sabotage.

entry.title: From The First Step, To Always
entry.summary:
Author: IrishMum1710

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,603Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 0

Summary: When celebrity chef Evan â€œBuckâ€ Buckley signs on for Dancing with the Stars, he expects chaos, cameras, and a steep learning curve. What he doesnâ€™t expect is Eddie DÃ­az â€” a disciplined, exacting professional dancer whose control is as precise as Buckâ€™s energy is unruly. Paired together for the season, Buck and Eddie clash immediately: chaos versus control, feeling versus technique. Rehearsals are messy, frustrating, and unexpectedly electric. As Buck learns the steps and Eddie learns to loosen his grip, their partnership becomes something deeper â€” built on trust, patience, and the quiet promise of never letting the other fall. Set against the glitter, pressure, and intimacy of the ballroom floor, this is a story about learning to move together â€” and choosing each other, from the first step to always.

entry.title: I know they're losing (and I'll pay for my place by the ring)
entry.summary:
Author: funnyfeelingbuckley

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 62,950Chapters: 15/?Kudos: 67

Summary: It started as an outlet, at first. A way to let out his anger in a controlled manner, with a willing opponent who would offer him the pain that he deserved. He felt itchy. Teen pregnancy in a Catholic household had cloaked him with such a thick layer of shame that he needed a way to forget. It was a good thing, he tells himself. It was an honest thing - born out of good intentions. Until it wasn't. - Or Instead of enlisting in the military, Eddie makes money via an underground fight club in Texas. After threats against his family are leveled, Eddie finds a way to Los Angeles with the help of Athena Grant. Now working as private security, he begins working for Evan "Buck" Buckley, an arrogant and hot-headed singer/songwriter who may just give Eddie Diaz a run for his money. entry.title: What a night to forget.
entry.summary:
Author: Absolute_Maniac

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,260Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 40

Summary: â€œHey, can you see my phone anywhere?â€ he asked. Eddie started looking around the bed and then stretched himself to his side of the bed and pulled it from the nightstand.â€œHere.â€ He tossed it to him, and Buck immediately started looking through recent pictures on his phone. Pictures of them partying, a video of Eddie taking a shot, and another video of Eddie dancing.Then he came across the next picture and felt as if someone had thrown a bucket of ice water over his head. They must have asked someone else to take the picture because it was taken from at least a two-meter distance. The two of them were holding out a piece of paper towards the cameraâ€¦ and they were pressed together in a passionate kiss.Buck looked up from the picture when Eddie made a strangled sound on the other side of the room. â€œYou might want to see thisâ€¦â€ He reached over with a piece of paper in his hand. Buck took it and turned his phone over to him in return. Eddie bit into his fist as he studied the picture. Buck looked down at the paper in his hand and turned it over to the right side. It was a copy of a marriage license for Mr. Evan Buckley-Diaz and Mr. Edmundo Buckley-Diaz.

entry.title: The Grinch Man
entry.summary:
Author: binding13girl

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,120Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 19

Summary: Chim and Henâ€™s newfound fixation of their attention has convinced Buck to turn around and see where they are staring. When Buck turns around he searches for a few seconds before he sees an unknown man in the locker room.The first thing to invade his line of vision is a set of abs that look like they are carved from the gods. Attached to them is a man who looks like he is trying to perform a reverse striptease.After a few seconds, Buck can finally get a clear look at this new personâ€™s face. When he does his heart stops. It feels like a bucket of ice cold water is being dumped on him and his beautiful day. His eyes are threatening to bulge out of his head and a wave of pure loathing rushes over him.The only thought running through his head; The Grinch man is here, in my station, and in a uniform!?ORAn AU take on Eddie's first day at work and the first time Buck and Eddie meet (or maybe not??).

This is why he also knows his coping mechanisms canâ€™t possibly get any worse. Buck, as he so often does, makes him reevaluate his assumptions.â€”Evan Buckley dies behind a wall of glass. entry.title: Second Chance
entry.summary:
Author: sweetie_mae

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,443Chapters: 4/10Kudos: 165

Summary: â€œI got the call today,â€ he said finally, voice barely above a whisper. â€œThey tested me. Iâ€™m a match.â€She straightened. â€œFor Christopher?â€Buck nodded. â€œYeah. They think a transplant could save him.â€Silence settled between them, heavy, familiar. She looked away, her eyes fixed on the photo of Daniel on the fridge.â€œYou know what this means, Buck,â€ she said quietly.â€œI do,â€ he murmured. â€œI just keep thinking about him. About how it didnâ€™t work. I was supposed to save him and I wasnâ€™t enoughâ€Maddieâ€™s voice softened. â€œYou were a baby, Buck. You did everything you could. It wasnâ€™t your fault.â€He shook his head. â€œWhat if it happens again? I-I mean, what if I fail him too?â€OrAfter months of subtle, overlooked symptoms, Christopherâ€™s health suddenly collapses. A shocking diagnosis follows, bringing heartbreak, fading hopes, and one final chance: Buck.
